Description: Fragment of oval handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora at neck join. Clay near fine pink-buff. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 139 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 143.)
Curator's comments: Petrie Diary (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 185, 8. Name Lapheides. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0167.39.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1007)
